name: brunch cardigan
notes:
this silky soft sweater is so much simpler than it looks. made from two basic hexagons, you’ll love watching your cardigan take shape before your very eyes!

and because of how it’s constructed, you can try it on and adjust as you crochet, making this the perfect pattern for garment-making newbies.

velour yarn keeps your sweater on trend while ensuring you feel pajama-like comfiness all day long.

pdf includes written pattern, tutorial photos, a stitch chart and pattern diagram, a link to a video preview of the sweater in action, plus notes on making your sweater longer if desired.

you're going to be so glad this scrumptious cardigan is part of your handmade wardrobe!

this pattern originally appeared on make & do crew.

skill level - intermediate

sizing/measurements - fit is intended to be oversized. for a tighter fit, size down. sample pictured is a m/l on a 5’9” model with a 41” bust. sizes are listed in women's sizes.

fits bust (inches):*

size fits bust length
s/m.........28-34”............27”
m/l……….34-40”…………29”
l/1x……….40-46”………..31”
1x/2x…….46-52”………...33”
2x/3x…….52-58”…………37”

* see additional details in overall pattern notes to determine sizing.

downloading - this listing is for the brunch cardigan crochet pattern pdf only. pattern pdf will be available for instant download upon payment. 

copyright/making finished items - thank you for sharing my patterns and tutorials. when you do, it helps support the blog and my ability to create more patterns. which, by the way, i seriously love to do. so really, i mean it, thank you.

you may make items to sell with this pattern/tutorial. in exchange, i ask that you link back to makeanddocrew.com. do not use my photos as your own sales photos. do not distribute my patterns/templates as your own. permission is not granted for mass production or factory manufacturing of any kind.

return policy - as this is a digital product, i do not offer returns.
